definitionList.name: E-RAB SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME and is used
to request the eNB to assign resources on Uu and S1 for one or several E-RABs.

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Setup Item IEs
E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters.

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: EPC TEID.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE, the
  maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB and is used to report the outcome of the request from the
E-RAB SETUP REQUEST message.

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: eNB TEID.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed to Setup List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB Setup List IE and in E-RAB Failed to Setup List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB MODIFY REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used to request the eNB to modify the Data Radio Bearers
and the allocated resources on Uu and S1 for one or several E-RABs or to change
the S-GW as defined in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Modified Item IEs
E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB MODIFY RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB and is used to report the outcome of the request from the
E-RAB MODIFY REQUEST message.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed to Modify List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB Modify List IE and E-RAB Failed to Modify List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB RELEASE COMMAND
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used to request the eNB to release allocated
resources on Uu and S1 for one or several E-RABs.

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Released List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB To Be Released List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE, the
  maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB RELEASE RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB and is used to report the outcome of the request from the E-RAB
RELEASE COMMAND message.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed to Release List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB Release List IE and E-RAB Failed to Release List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB RELEASE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB and is used to indicate the MME to release one or several
E-RABs for one UE.

elementList.name: E-RAB Released List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB Released List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB and is used to request the MME to apply the indicated
modification for one or several E-RABs.

elementList.name: E-RAB to Be Modified Item IEs
E-RAB not to be Modified List
E-RAB not to Be Modified Item IEs
Tunnel Information for BBF
elementList.description: Indicating HeNB s Local IP Address assigned by the broadband access provider, UDP port Number.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: E-RAB MODIFICATION CONFIRM
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used to report the outcome of the request from the
E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed to Modify List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in the E-RAB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message.

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Released List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in the E-RAB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: INITIAL CONTEXT SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to request the
setup of a UE context.

elementList.name: E-RAB to Be Setup Item IEs
E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters.

elementList.name: Security Key
elementList.description: The KeNB is provided after the key-generation in the MME, see TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
GUMMEI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the MME serving the UE.

elementList.name: MME UE S1AP ID 2
elementList.description: This IE indicates the MME UE S1AP ID assigned by the MME.

elementList.name: UE User Plane CIoT Support Indicator
UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the CS Fallback
  Indicator IE is set to  CS
  Fallback High Priority .

definitionList.name: INITIAL CONTEXT SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to confirm
the setup of a UE context.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed to Setup List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB Setup List IE and E-RAB Failed to Setup List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: INITIAL CONTEXT SETUP FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
that the setup of the UE context was unsuccessful.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to request
the release of the UE-associated S1-logical connection over the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE COMMAND
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to request
the release of the UE-associated S1-logical connection over the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE COMPLETE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to confirm
the release of the UE-associated S1-logical connection over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: Information on Recommended Cells and eNBs for Paging
Cell Identifier and Coverage Enhancement Level

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT MODIFICATION REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to provide
UE Context information changes to the eNB.

elementList.name: Security Key
elementList.description: A fresh KeNB is provided after performing a key-change on the fly procedure in the MME, see TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the CS Fallback
  Indicator IE is set to  CS
  Fallback High Priority .

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT MODIFICATION RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to confirm
the performed UE context updates.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT MODIFICATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB in case the
performed UE context update is not successful.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY MATCH REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to request the compatibility
between the UE radio capabilities and network configuration.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY MATCH RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to report the compatibility
between the UE radio capabilities and network configuration.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT MODIFICATION INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is sent by the eNB to request the MME to modify the UE Context information.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT MODIFICATION CONFIRM
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to confirm the modification
of the UE Context information.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT SUSPEND REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to request the MME to suspend the UE context
and the related bearer contexts.

elementList.name: Information on Recommended Cells and eNBs for Paging
Cell Identifier and Coverage Enhancement Level

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT SUSPEND RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to indicate
to the eNB the UE context and the related bearer contexts have been suspended.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RESUME REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to request the MME to indicate that the
suspended RRC connection has been resumed, or the UE accesses for early data
transmission.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed To Resume Item IEs

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RESUME RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to indicate
to the eNB that the UE context and the related bearer contexts have been resumed
in the EPC.

elementList.name: E-RAB Failed To Resume Item IEs

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE,
  the maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RESUME FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to indicate
to the eNB that resumption of the UE context and the related bearer contexts
has failed in the EPC.

definitionList.name: CONNECTION ESTABLISHMENT INDICATION
descriptionList: This message is sent by the MME to complete the establishment of the UE-associated logical S1-connection.

elementList.name: UE Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes QoS parameters.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE INFORMATION
descriptionList:
The message is sent
by the eNB to request UE information over the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: UE INFORMATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
The message is sent
by the MME to transfer UE information over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: UE Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes QoS parameters.

definitionList.name: eNB CP RELOCATION INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB to initiate the establishment of a UE-associated logical
S1-connection, following the reception of re-establishment request as described
in TS. 36.300 [14].

definitionList.name: MME CP RELOCATION INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to inform the eNB that the UE is to be relocated as described
in TS. 36.300 [14].

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUIRED
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the source eNB to the MME to request the preparation of resources at
the target.

elementList.name: Source to Target Transparent Container Secondary

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Handover
  Type IE is set to the  Value  LTEtoGERAN and the SRVCC HO Indication IE is present.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER COMMAND
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to inform the source eNB that resources for the handover
have been prepared at the target side.

elementList.name: NAS Security Parameters from E-UTRAN
elementList.description: The eNB shall use this IE as specified in TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject to Forwarding Item IEs
DL GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver forwarded DL PDCP SDUs.

elementList.name: UL GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver forwarded UL PDCP SDUs.

elementList.name: Target to Source Transparent Container Secondary

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Handover Type
  IE is set to the value  LTEtoUTRAN   or  LTEtoGERAN .

definitionList.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to inform the source eNB that the Handover Preparation has failed.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to the target eNB to request the preparation of resources.

elementList.name: E-RABs To Be Setup Item IEs
GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver UL PDUs.

elementList.name: E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
elementList.description: Includes necessary QoS parameters.

elementList.name: NAS Security Parameters to E-UTRAN
elementList.description: The eNB shall use this IE as specified in TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: GUMMEI
elementList.description: This IE indicates the MME serving the UE.

elementList.name: MME UE S1AP ID 2
elementList.description: This IE indicates the MME UE S1AP ID assigned by the MME.

elementList.name: UE User Plane CIoT Support Indicator
UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Handover Type
  IE is set to the value  UTRANtoLTE  or  GERANtoLTE .

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the target eNB to inform the MME about the prepared resources at the
target.

elementList.name: eNB UE S1AP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target eNB.

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver DL PDUs.

elementList.name: DL GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver forwarded DL PDCP SDUs.

elementList.name: UL GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver forwarded UL PDCP SDUs.

elementList.name: E-RABs Failed to Setup List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RABs Admitted List IE and E-RABs Failed to Setup List IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the target eNB to inform the MME that the preparation of resources
has failed.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER NOTIFY
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the target eNB to inform the MME that the UE has been identified in
the target cell and the S1 handover has been completed.

elementList.name: Tunnel Information for BBF
elementList.description: Indicating HeNB s Local IP Address assigned by the broadband access provider, UDP port Number.

definitionList.name: PATH SWITCH REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB to request the MME to switch DL GTP tunnel termination
point(s) from one end-point to another.

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Switched in Downlink List
E-RABs Switched in Downlink Item IEs
GTP-TEID
elementList.description: To deliver DL PDUs.

elementList.name: Tunnel Information for BBF
elementList.description: Indicating HeNB s Local IP Address assigned by the broadband access provider, UDP port Number.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PATH SWITCH REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to inform the eNB that the path switch has been successfully
completed in the EPC.

elementList.name: E-RAB To Be Switched in Uplink List
E-RABs Switched in Uplink Item IEs
E-RAB To Be Released List
elementList.description: A value for E-RAB ID shall only be present once in E-RAB To Be Switched in Uplink List IE and E-RAB to Be Released List IE.

elementList.name: Security Context
elementList.description: One pair of {NCC, NH} is provided.

elementList.name: MME UE S1AP ID 2
elementList.description: This IE indicates the MME UE S1AP ID assigned by the MME.

elementList.name: UE User Plane CIoT Support Indicator
UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services.

elementList.name: NR UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

elementList.name: PC5 QoS Parameters
elementList.description: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for NR V2X services.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PATH SWITCH REQUEST FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME to inform the eNB that a failure has occurred in the EPC during
the Path switch request procedure.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
the MME to request the cancellation of an ongoing handover.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to the
source eNB to confirm that the ongoing handover was cancelled.

definitionList.name: eNB STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to transfer the PDCP SN
receiver and transmitter status.

definitionList.name: MME STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to transfer the PDCP-SN receiver and
transmitter status.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER SUCCESS
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to the source eNB to indicate the successful
access of the UE toward the target eNB.

definitionList.name: eNB EARLY STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source eNB to
transfer the COUNT value(s) of the first forwarded downlink SDU(s) during S1
DAPS Handover.

elementList.name: eNB Early Status Transfer Transparent Container

definitionList.name: MME EARLY STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to transfer
the COUNT value(s) of the first forwarded downlink SDU(s) during S1 DAPS
Handover.

elementList.name: eNB Early Status Transfer Transparent Container

definitionList.name: PAGING
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used to page a UE in one or several tracking areas.

elementList.name: Paging DRX
elementList.description: If the NB-IoT Paging DRX IE is included, the Paging DRX IE is ignored.

elementList.name: Data size
elementList.description: The unit is: bit

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of TAIs. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of CSG Ids within the CSG Id List.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: INITIAL UE MESSAGE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the eNB to transfer the initial layer 3 message to the MME over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: TAI
elementList.description: Indicating the Tracking Area from which the UE has sent the NAS message.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN CGI
elementList.description: Indicating the E-UTRAN CGI from which the UE has sent the NAS message.

elementList.name: GW Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Indicating GW Transport Layer Address if the GW is collocated with eNB.

elementList.name: Relay Node Indicator
elementList.description: Indicating a relay node.

elementList.name: Tunnel Information for BBF
elementList.description: Indicating HeNB s Local IP Address assigned by the broadband access provider, UDP port Number.

elementList.name: SIPTO L-GW Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Indicating SIPTO L-GW Transport Layer Address if the SIPTO L-GW is collocated with eNB.

elementList.name: UE Application Layer Measurement Capability
elementList.description: Each bit in the bitmap indicates an UE Application layer measurement capability, refer to TS 25.331[10]. Bit 0 = QoE Measurement for streaming service Bit 1 = QoE Measurement for MTSI service Value 1 indicates Capable and value 0 indicates not Capable . Unused bits are reserved for future use.

elementList.name: IAB Node Indication
elementList.description: Indication of an IAB-node.

definitionList.name: DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used for carrying NAS information over the S1
interface.

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
DL NAS PDU Delivery Acknowledgment Request

definitionList.name: UPLINK NAS TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for carrying NAS information over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: GW Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Indicating GW Transport Layer Address if the GW is collocated with eNB.

elementList.name: SIPTO L-GW Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Indicating SIPTO L-GW Transport Layer Address if the SIPTO L-GW is collocated with eNB.

definitionList.name: NAS NON DELIVERY INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for reporting the non delivery of a NAS PDU previously received within a
DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message over the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: NAS DELIVERY INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for reporting the successful delivery of a NAS PDU to the UE that was previously
received within a DOWNLINK NAS TRANSPORT message.

definitionList.name: REROUTE NAS REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME in order to request for a rerouting of the INITIAL UE
MESSAGE to a DCN.

elementList.name: S1 Message
elementList.description: Contains the INITIAL UE MESSAGE

definitionList.name: RESET
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the MME and
the eNB and is used to request that the S1 interface, or parts of the S1
interface, to be reset.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MME → eNB and eNB → MME

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of UE-associated logical
  S1-connections allowed to reset in one message. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: RESET ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the MME and
the eNB as a response to a RESET message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: eNB → MME and MME → eNB.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of UE-associated logical
  S1-connections allowed to reset in one message. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: ERROR INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the MME and
the eNB and is used to indicate that some error has been detected in the node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: MME → eNB and eNB → MME

acknowledge the eNB transfer updated information for a TNL association.

Maximum no. of DCNs servered by one MME. Value
  is 32.

definitionList.name: MME CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to
acknowledge the MME transfer updated information for a TNL association.

definitionList.name: MME CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
S1 MME Configuration Update failure.

definitionList.name: OVERLOAD START
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME and is used
to indicate to the eNB that the MME is overloaded.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of MMECs per node per RAT. Value is
  256.

definitionList.name: OVERLOAD STOP
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used to indicate that the MME is no longer overloaded.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of MMECs per node per RAT. Value is
  256.

definitionList.name: DOWNLINK S1 CDMA2000 TUNNELLING
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used for carrying CDMA2000 information over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject to Forwarding Item IEs
DL GTP-TEID
elementList.description: This IE indicates the tunnel endpoint for forwarding of DL data.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: UPLINK S1 CDMA2000 TUNNELLING
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for carrying CDMA2000 information over the S1 interface.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Round Trip Delay Estimation Info

definitionList.name: UE CAPABILITY INFO INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to provide
UE Radio Capability information to the MME.

elementList.name: UE Application Layer Measurement Capability
elementList.description: Each bit in the bitmap indicates an UE Application layer measurement capability, refer to TS 25.331[10]. Bit 0 = QoE Measurement for streaming service Bit 1 = QoE Measurement for MTSI service Value 1 indicates Capable and value 0 indicates not Capable . Unused bits are reserved for future use.

definitionList.name: TRACE START
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to initiate
trace recording for a UE.

definitionList.name: TRACE FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
that a Trace Start procedure or a Deactivate Trace procedure has failed for a
UE.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: As per E-UTRAN Trace ID IE in Trace Activation IE (9.2.1.4).

definitionList.name: DEACTIVATE TRACE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to deactivate
trace.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: As per E-UTRAN Trace ID IE in Trace Activation IE (9.2.1.4).

definitionList.name: LOCATION REPORTING CONTROL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME and is used to request the eNB to report
where the UE is currently located.

definitionList.name: LOCATION REPORT FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used to indicate
the failure of location report.

definitionList.name: LOCATION REPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used to provide the UE s location
to the MME.

elementList.name: Request Type
elementList.description: The Request Type IE is sent as it has been provided.

definitionList.name: WRITE-REPLACE WARNING REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME to request
the start or overwrite of the broadcast of a warning message.

definitionList.name: WRITE-REPLACE WARNING RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to acknowledge
the MME on the start or overwrite request of a warning message.

definitionList.name: KILL REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is forwarded by the MME to eNB
to cancel an already ongoing broadcast of a warning message

definitionList.name: KILL RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to indicate
the list of warning areas where cancellation of the broadcast of the identified
message was successful and unsuccessful.

definitionList.name: PWS RESTART INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to inform the MME that PWS information for some or all cells of the
eNB are available for reloading from the CBC if needed.

elementList.name: Emergency Area ID List for Restart

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for reloading warning messages broadcast. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for reloading warning message broadcast. Value
  is 2048.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for reloading warning message broadcast. Value
  is 256.

definitionList.name: PWS FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to inform the MME that ongoing PWS operation for one or more cells
of the eNB has failed.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of cells that can be served by an
  eNB. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: eNB DIRECT INFORMATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB in order to
transfer specific information.

definitionList.name: MME DIRECT INFORMATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME in order to
transfer specific information.

definitionList.name: eNB CONFIGURATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB in order to
transfer RAN configuration information.

elementList.name: Inter-system SON Configuration Transfer
elementList.description: Contains the Inter-system SON Configuration Transfer IE as defined in TS 38.413 [44].

definitionList.name: MME CONFIGURATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME in order to
transfer RAN configuration information.

elementList.name: Inter-system SON Configuration Transfer
elementList.description: Contains the Inter-system SON Configuration Transfer IE as defined in TS 38.413 [44].

definitionList.name: CELL TRAFFIC TRACE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by eNB to transfer specific
information.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [10] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.3.8), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [10] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [10]

definitionList.name: DOWNLINK UE ASSOCIATED LPPA TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used for carrying LPPa message over the S1
interface.

definitionList.name: UPLINK UE ASSOCIATED LPPA TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for carrying LPPa message over
the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: DOWNLINK NON UE ASSOCIATED LPPA TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the MME and is used for carrying LPPa message over the S1
interface.

definitionList.name: UPLINK NON UE ASSOCIATED LPPA TRANSPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
for carrying LPPa message over
the S1 interface.

definitionList.name: SECONDARY RAT DATA USAGE REPORT
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB to report
Secondary RAT data usage.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the eNB and is used
to request the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE Radio
Capability ID.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the MME and is used
to provide the UE Radio Capability information that maps to a specific UE Radio
Capability ID indicated in the UE RADIO CAPABILITY ID MAPPING REQUEST message.

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely identifies
the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, )

definitionList.name: E-RAB ID
descriptionList:
This element uniquely identifies a radio
access bearer for a particular UE, which makes the E-RAB ID unique over one S1
connection. The E-RAB ID shall remain the same for the duration of the E-RAB
even if the UE-associated logical S1-connection is
released or moved using S1 handover.

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Cause IE is to indicate
the reason for a particular event for the S1AP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Unspecified, TX2RELOCOverall Expiry, Successful Handover, Release due to E-UTRAN Generated Reason, Handover Cancelled, Partial Handover, Handover Failure In Target EPC/eNB Or Target System, Handover Target not allowed, TS1RELOCoverall Expiry, TS1RELOCprep Expiry, Cell not available, Unknown Target ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Unknown or already allocated MME UE S1AP ID, Unknown or already allocated eNB UE S1AP ID, Unknown or inconsistent pair of UE S1AP ID, Handover desirable for radio reasons, Time critical handover, Resource optimisation handover, Reduce load in serving cell, User inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Load Balancing TAU Required, CS Fallback Triggered, UE Not Available For PS Service, Radio resources not available, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Invalid QoS combination, Inter-RAT redirection, Interaction with other procedure, Unknown E-RAB ID, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Encryption and/or integrity protection algorithms not supported, S1 intra system Handover triggered, S1 inter system Handover triggered, X2 Handover triggered , Redirection towards 1xRTT, Not supported QCI value, invalid CSG Id, Release due to Pre-Emption, N26 interface not available, Insufficient UE Capabilities)

elementList.name: NAS Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Normal Release, Authentication failure, Detach, Unspecified, , CSG Subscription Expiry)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, )

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Unspecified, Unknown PLMN, )

definitionList.name: RRC Establishment Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the RRC Establishment
Cause IE is to indicate to the MME the reason for RRC Connection Establishment
or RRC Connection Resume as received from the UE in the EstablishmentCause,
EstablishmentCause-NB or ResumeCause defined in TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: RRC Establishment Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(emergency, highPriorityAccess, mt-Access, mo-Signalling, mo-Data, ,delayTolerantAccess, mo-VoiceCall, mo-ExceptionData)

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList:
Defines parameters related to a trace
activation.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Trace ID
elementList.description: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [10] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.3.8), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [10] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Interfaces To Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an eNB or en-gNB interface: first bit =S1-MME, second bit =X2, third bit =Uu, fourth bit =F1-C, fifth bit =E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates should be traced . Value 0 indicates should not be traced .

elementList.name: Trace depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED( minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, )
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [10].

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: For File based Reporting. Defined in TS 32.422 [10]. This IE is ignored if the Trace Collection Entity URI IE is present

elementList.name: MDT Configuration NR
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [44]. Only the immediate MDT configurations are included in the IE in this version of the specification.

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity URI
elementList.description: For Streaming based Reporting. Defined in TS 32.422 [10] Replaces Trace Collection Entity IP Address if present

definitionList.name: Target ID
descriptionList:
The Target ID IE identifies the target
for the handover. The target ID may be, e.g., the target Global eNB-ID (for
intra SAE/LTE), the RNC-ID (for SAE/LTE-UMTS handover) or the Cell Global ID of
the handover target (in case of SAE/LTE to GERAN A/Gb mode handover).

elementList.name: RNC-ID
elementList.description: If the Extended RNC-ID IE is included in the Target ID IE, the RNC-ID IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Extended RNC-ID
elementList.description: The Extended RNC-ID IE shall be used if the RNC identity has a value larger than 4095.

elementList.name: LAC
elementList.description: 0000 and FFFE not allowed.

definitionList.name: Source eNB to Target eNB Transparent Container
descriptionList:
The Source eNB to target eNB Transparent
Container IE is an information element that is produced by the source eNB and is transmitted to the target
eNB. For inter-system handovers
to E-UTRAN, the IE is transmitted from the external handover source to the
target eNB.
This IE is transparent to the EPC.

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: Includes the RRC Handover Preparation Information message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
Mobility Information
elementList.description: Information related to the handover; the external handover source provides it in order to enable later analysis of the conditions that led to a wrong HO.

elementList.name: UE History Information from the UE
elementList.description: VisitedCellInfoList contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [16])

elementList.name: Emergency Indicator
elementList.description: Indicates an emergency EPS voice fallback

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Target eNB to Source eNB Transparent Container
descriptionList:
The Target eNB to Source eNB Transparent
Container IE is an information element that is produced by the target eNB and is transmitted to the source eNB. For inter-system handovers to E-UTRAN, the IE is transmitted
from the target eNB to the external relocation source.
This IE is transparent to EPC.

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: Includes the RRC E-UTRA Handover Command message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: DAPS Response Information
elementList.description: Indicates the response to a requested DAPS Handover

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no.
  of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Handover Type
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
which kind of handover was triggered in the source side.

elementList.name: Handover Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (IntraLTE, LTEtoUTRAN, LTEtoGERAN, UTRANtoLTE, GERANtoLTE, EPSto5GS, 5GStoEPS )

definitionList.name: Extended RNC-ID
descriptionList:
The Extended RNC-ID is used to identify an
RNC.

elementList.name: Extended RNC-ID
elementList.description: The Extended RNC-ID IE shall be used if the RNC identity has a value larger than 4095.

definitionList.name: E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an
E-RAB.

elementList.name: QCI
elementList.description: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [11]. Coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].

elementList.name: GBR QoS Information
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [11]) and indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [11]) and indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplilnk direction as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

definitionList.name: Paging DRX
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Paging DRX as defined
in TS 36.304 [20].

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the maximum and
guaranteed bit rates of a GBR bearer for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] for this bearer. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum uplink E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] for this bearer. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] (provided that there is data to deliver) for this bearer. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the uplink guaranteed E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] (provided that there is data to deliver) for this bearer. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum downlink E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] for this bearer.

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the maximum uplink E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] for this bearer.

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the downlink guaranteed E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] (provided that there is data to deliver) for this bearer.

elementList.name: Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the uplink guaranteed E-RAB Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] (provided that there is data to deliver) for this bearer.

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits delivered
by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in
sidelink within a period of time, divided by the
duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or
guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s.

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is
applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and
the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for non-GBR E-RABs.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] in the downlink direction. If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] in the uplink direction. Receiving both the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE and the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE equal to value zero shall be considered as a logical error by the eNB. If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored.

elementList.name: Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.401 [11] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the eNB or the MME when parts of a received message have not been comprehended
or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable,
it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

For further details on how to use the Criticality
Diagnostics IE, (see clause 10).

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value ignore shall not be used.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported
  with a single message. The value for maxnoofErrors is 256.

definitionList.name: Handover Restriction List
descriptionList:
This IE defines roaming or access
restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the
eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the
UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or
for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation.
If the eNB receives the Handover Restriction List IE, it shall overwrite
previously received restriction information.

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of equivalent PLMNs as defined in TS 24.301 [24]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: Forbidden TAs
elementList.description: Intra LTE roaming restrictions.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: The PLMN of forbidden TACs.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the forbidden TAI.

elementList.name: Forbidden LAs
elementList.description: Inter-3GPP RAT roaming restrictions.

elementList.name: Forbidden inter RATs
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(ALL, GERAN, UTRAN, CDMA2000, , GERAN and UTRAN, CDMA2000 and UTRAN)
elementList.description: Inter-3GPP and 3GPP2 RAT access restrictions. ALL means that all RATs mentioned in the enumeration of this IE are restricted.

elementList.name: NR Restriction in EPS as Secondary RAT
elementList.description: Restriction to use NR when the NR is used as secondary RAT in EN-DC.

elementList.name: Unlicensed Spectrum Restriction
elementList.description: Restriction to use unlicensed spectrum in the form of LAA or LWA/LWIP or NR-U as described in TS 23.401 [11].

elementList.name: Core Network Type Restrictions
elementList.description: Includes any of the Serving PLMN or any PLMN of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which Core network type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [46].

elementList.name: Core Network Type
elementList.description: Indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to 5GC or to EPC for this PLMN.

elementList.name: NR Restriction in 5GS
elementList.description: Restriction to use NR when the NR connects to 5GS.

elementList.name: Last NG-RAN PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Indicates the NG-RAN PLMN ID from where the UE formerly handed over to EPS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to 5GS.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of equivalent PLMN Ids. Value is
  15.

Maximum no. of equivalent PLMN Ids plus one.
  Value is 16.

Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes. Value
  is 4096.

Maximum no. of forbidden Location Area Codes. Value
  is 4096.

definitionList.name: CDMA2000-PDU
descriptionList:
This
information element contains a CDMA2000 message between the UE and CDMA2000 RAT
that is transferred without interpretation in the eNB.

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 RAT Type
descriptionList:
In the
uplink, this information element, along with the CDMA2000 Sector ID IE
is used for routing the tunnelled CDMA2000 message to the proper destination
node in the CDMA2000 RAT and is set by the eNB to the CDMA2000 RAT type
received from the UE.

NOTE:      In the downlink, this information element
is used by the eNB to provide an indication of the RAT Type associated with the
tunnelled CDMA2000 message to the UE to help it route the tunnelled downlink CDMA2000
message to the appropriate CDMA upper layer.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 RAT Type
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify which CDMA2000 RAT the tunnelled CDMA2000 signalling is associated with. The source of this information in the uplink is the UE and in the downlink it is the CDMA2000 system.

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 Sector ID
descriptionList:
This information
element, along with the RAT Type IE is used for routing the tunnelled
CDMA2000 message to the proper destination node in the CDMA2000 RAT.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 Sector ID
elementList.description: This IE is set to CDMA2000 Reference Cell ID corresponding to the HRPD/1xRTT sector under the HRPD AN/1xBS towards which the signalling is performed. The CDMA2000 Reference Cell ID is statically configured in the eNB. If the RAT type is HRPD, this IE contains the HRPD Sector ID as specified in 3GPP2 C.S0024-B [27]. If the RAT type is 1x RTT, this IE is encoded as the Reference Cell ID IE in 3GPP2 A.S0008-C [25].

definitionList.name: Security Context
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Security Context IE is to provide security related parameters to the eNB which
are used to derive security keys for user plane traffic and RRC signalling messages
and for security parameter generation for subsequent X2 or intra eNB Handovers,
or for the security parameters for the current S1 Handover. For intra LTE S1 Handover
one pair of {NCC, NH} is provided for 1-hop security, see TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Counter (NCC) defined in TS 33.401 [15]. For handover from 5GS to EPS, Next Hop Chaining Count IE = 2 as defined in TS 33.501 [48]. For other inter-RAT Handover into LTE the Next Hop Chaining Count IE takes the value defined for NCC at initial setup, i.e., Next Hop Chaining Count IE = 0 .

elementList.name: Next-Hop NH
elementList.description: The NH together with the NCC is used to derive the security configuration as defined in TS 33.401 [15]. For inter RAT Handover the Next-Hop NH IE is the KeNB to be used in the new configuration.

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability
descriptionList:
This IE
contains UE Radio Capability information.

elementList.name: UE Radio Capability
elementList.description: Includes either the UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation message as defined in 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [16], or the UERadioAccessCapabilityInformation-NB message as defined in 10.6.2 of TS 36.331 [16].

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 HO Status
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate to the eNB which
initiated an inter-RAT HO towards CDMA2000 about the outcome of the handover
preparation to CDMA2000.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 HO Status
elementList.description: This IE indicates the status of the handover resource allocation in the CDMA2000 RAT.

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 HO Required Indication
descriptionList:
This information
element is set by the eNB to provide an indication about whether the UE has
initiated the handover preparation with the CDMA2000 RAT.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 HO Required Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates to MME that handover preparation to CDMA2000 has been started. It helps MME to decide when to send certain handover preparation information for HRPD (TS 23.402 [8]) and 1xRTT (TS 23.216 [9]) to the CDMA2000 RAT.

definitionList.name: eNB Status Transfer Transparent Container
descriptionList:
The eNB Status Transfer Transparent
Container IE is an information element that is produced by the source eNB and is transmitted to the target
eNB. This IE is used for the intra SAE/LTE S1 handover case.
This IE is transparent to the EPC.

elementList.name: E-RABs Subject to Status Transfer List
E-RABs Subject to Status Transfer Item
UL COUNT value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN of first missing UL PDCP SDU in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: DL COUNT value
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN that the target eNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs
elementList.description: PDCP Sequence Number = (First Missing SDU Number + bit position) modulo 4096. 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN of first missing UL PDCP SDU in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value Extended
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN that the target eNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN in this release. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.1.100
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN of first missing UL PDCP SDU in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.1.100
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and HFN that the target eNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN.

elementList.name: Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of E-RABs for one UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value
descriptionList:
This IE contains a PDCP sequence number and
a hyper frame number in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN.

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT RAND
descriptionList:
This
information element is a random number generated by the eNB and tunnelled to
the 1xCS IWS (TS 23.402 [8]) and is transparent to MME.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT RAND
elementList.description: This IE is a Random Challenge that is used for authentication of UE during 1xCS registration, eCSFB to 1xRTT or handover from E-UTRAN to CDMA2000 1xRTT RAT. This IE is coded as the RAND (32bits) of the Authentication Challenge Parameter (RAND) in 3GPP2 A.S0008-C [25].

definitionList.name: Request Type
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Request Type IE is to indicate the type of location request to be handled
by the eNB.

elementList.name: Event Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(Direct, Change of service cell, Stop Change of service cell, )

definitionList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT SRVCC Info
descriptionList:
This IE defines SRVCC related information
elements that are assembled by the MME to be tunnelled transparently to the
1xCS IWS (TS 23.402 [8]) system.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT MEID
elementList.description: This information element is the Mobile Equipment Identifier or Hardware ID that is tunnelled from the UE and is transparent to the eNB. This IE is used to derive a MEID-based PLCM that is used for channelization in CDMA2000 1xRTT network.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT Mobile Subscription Information
elementList.description: This IE provides the list of UE supported 1x RTT Band classes and Band Subclasses. It is provided by the UE to the eNB as part of the UE capability. It is transparent to the eNB.

elementList.name: CDMA2000 1xRTT Pilot List
elementList.description: This IE provides the measured pilot information. Encoded as the Pilot List IE from the A21-1x air interface signalling message in 3GPP2 A.S0008-C [25].

definitionList.name: E-RAB List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of E-RAB IDs with a
cause value. It is used for example to indicate failed bearers or bearers to be
released.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of E-RAB allowed towards one UE, the
  maximum value is 256.

definitionList.name: Global eNB ID
descriptionList:
This information
element is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

elementList.name: Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see subclause 9.2.1.38) of each cell served by the eNB.

elementList.name: Home eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRAN CGI IE (see subclause 9.2.1.38) of the cell served by the eNB.

elementList.name: Short Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE (see subclause 9.2.1.38) of each cell served by the eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the Cell Identity IE (see subclause 9.2.1.38) of each cell served by the eNB.

definitionList.name: Global en-gNB ID
descriptionList:
This
information element is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

definitionList.name: E-UTRAN CGI
descriptionList:
This
information element is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

elementList.name: Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the Cell Identity correspond to the eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.1.37).

definitionList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
descriptionList:
The Subscriber
Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp
priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in
Active mode TS 36.300 [14].

elementList.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency Priority

definitionList.name: Additional RRM Policy Index
descriptionList:
The Additional RRM Policy Index IE
is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency
priority as specified in TS 36.300 [14].

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
The UE Security Capabilities IE
defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the
UE.

elementList.name: Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: all bits equal to 0 UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, first bit 128-EEA1, second bit 128-EEA2, third bit 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: all bits equal to 0 UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, first bit 128-EIA1, second bit 128-EIA2, third bit 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value 1 indicates support and value 0 indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [15].

definitionList.name: Security Key
descriptionList:
The Security Key IE is used to apply
security in the eNB for different scenarios as defined in TS 33.401 [15].

elementList.name: Security Key
elementList.description: Key material for KeNB or Next Hop Key as defined in TS 33.401 [15]

definitionList.name: UE History Information
descriptionList:
The UE History Information IE
contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state prior
to the target cell.

elementList.name: Last Visited Cell List
elementList.description: Most recent information is added to the top of this list.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum length of the list. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Last Visited Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information may
contain cell specific information.

elementList.name: Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 25.413 [19].

elementList.name: Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [44] (see subclause 9.3.1.97).

definitionList.name: Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information contains
information about a cell that is to be used for RRM purposes.

elementList.name: Time UE stayed in Cell
elementList.description: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 4095.

elementList.name: Time UE stayed in Cell Enhanced Granularity
elementList.description: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in 1/10 seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 40950.

elementList.name: HO Cause Value
elementList.description: The cause for the handover from the E-UTRAN cell.

definitionList.name: Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information for GERAN
is currently undefined.

NOTE:      If in later Releases this is defined,
the choice type may be extended with the actual GERAN specific information.

elementList.name: CHOICE Last Visited GERAN Cell Information

definitionList.name: Message Identifier
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Message Identifier
IE is to identify the warning message. Message Identifier IE is set by the EPC and transferred to the UE
by the eNB

elementList.name: Message Identifier
elementList.description: This IE is set by the EPC, transferred to the UE by the eNB. The eNB shall treat it as an identifier of the message.

definitionList.name: Serial Number
descriptionList:
The Serial Number IE identifies a
particular message from the source and type indicated by the Message Identifier
and is altered every time the message with a given Message Identifier is changed.

definitionList.name: Warning Area List
descriptionList:
The Warning Area List IE indicates the areas where the warning message needs to be
broadcast or cancelled.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message
  broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for
  warning message broadcast. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Emergency Area ID
descriptionList:
The Emergency
Area ID IE is used to indicate the area which has the emergency impact.

elementList.name: Emergency Area ID
elementList.description: Emergency Area ID may consist of several cells. Emergency Area ID is defined by the operator.

definitionList.name: Repetition Period
descriptionList:
The Repetition Period IE indicates the
periodicity of the warning message to be broadcast.

elementList.name: Repetition Period
elementList.description: The unit of value 1 to 4095 is [second].

definitionList.name: Number of Broadcasts Requested
descriptionList: The Number of Broadcast Requested IE indicates the number of times a message is to be broadcast.

definitionList.name: Warning Type
descriptionList:
The Warning Type IE indicates types of the disaster. This IE also indicates that a
Primary Notification is included. This IE can be used by the UE to
differentiate the type of alert according to the type of disaster.

definitionList.name: Warning Security Information
descriptionList:
The Warning Security Information IE provides the security information needed for securing the
Primary Notification.

definitionList.name: Data Coding Scheme
descriptionList:
The Data Coding Scheme IE identifies the alphabet or coding employed for the message characters
and message handling at the UE (it is passed transparently from the EPC to the
UE).

definitionList.name: Warning Message Contents
descriptionList:
The Warning
Message Content IE contains user information, e.g.,
the message with warning contents, and will be broadcast over the radio
interface.

elementList.name: Warning Message Contents
elementList.description: The length of this IE varies between 1 to 9600 bytes.

definitionList.name: Broadcast Completed Area List
descriptionList:
The Broadcast Completed Area List IE indicates the areas where either resources are available to
perform the broadcast or where broadcast is performed successfully.

elementList.name: Completed Cell in Emergency Area ID List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message broadcast.
  Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for
  warning message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within a TAI. Value is
  65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within an Emergency
  Area. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Inter-system Information Transfer Type
descriptionList:
The Inter-system Information Type IE
indicates the type of information that the eNB requests to transfer.

definitionList.name: Source To Target Transparent Container
descriptionList:
The Source to Target Transparent Container
IE is an information element that is used to transparently pass radio related
information from the handover source to the handover target through the EPC; it
is produced by the source RAN node
and is transmitted to the target RAN node.

elementList.name: Source to Target Transparent Container
elementList.description: This IE includes a transparent container from the source RAN node to the target RAN node. The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the target system. Note: in the current version of the specification, this IE may either carry the Source eNB to Target eNB Transparent Container IE or the Source RNC to Target RNC Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 25.413 [19] or the Source BSS to Target BSS Transparent Container Contents of the Source BSS to Target BSS Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 48.018 [18] or the Old BSS to New BSS information elements field of the Old BSS to New BSS information IE as defined in TS 48.008 [23], or the Source NG-RAN Node to Target NG-RAN Node Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 38.413 [44].

definitionList.name: Target To Source Transparent Container
descriptionList:
The Target to Source Transparent Container
IE is an information element that is used to transparently pass radio related
information from the handover target to the handover source through the EPC; it
is produced by the target RAN
node and is transmitted to the source RAN node.

elementList.name: Target to Source Transparent Container
elementList.description: This IE includes a transparent container from the target RAN node to the source RAN node. The octets of the OCTET STRING are coded according to the specifications of the target system. Note: in the current version of the specification, this IE may either carry the Target eNB to Source eNB Transparent Container IE, or the Target RNC to Source RNC Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 25.413 [19] or the Target BSS to Source BSS Transparent Container Contents of the Target BSS to Source BSS Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 48.018 [18] or the Layer 3 Information field of the Layer 3 Information IE as defined in TS 48.008 [23], or the Target NG-RAN Node to Source NG-RAN Node Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 38.413 [44].

definitionList.name: SRVCC Operation Possible
descriptionList:
This element indicates that both UE and MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour
on receipt of this IE is specified in TS 23.216 [9].

definitionList.name: SRVCC HO Indication
descriptionList:
This information element is set by the source eNB to provide an indication
that E-RAB may be subjected to
handover via SRVCC means.

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access
Bearer.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE should be understood as priority of allocation and retention (see TS 23.401 [11]). Usage: Value 15 means no priority . Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to preemption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

definitionList.name: Time to wait
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the minimum allowed waiting times.

definitionList.name: CSG Id
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the identifier
of the Closed Subscriber Group, as defined in TS 23.003 [21].

definitionList.name: MS Classmark 2
descriptionList:
The coding of this element is described in
TS 48.008 [23].

elementList.name: MS Classmark 2
elementList.description: Coded as the value part of the Classmark Information Type 2 IE defined in TS 48.008 [23].

definitionList.name: MS Classmark 3
descriptionList:
The coding of this element is described in
TS 48.008 [23].

elementList.name: MS Classmark 3
elementList.description: Coded as the value part of the Classmark Information Type 3 IE defined in TS 48.008 [23].

definitionList.name: Cell Type
descriptionList: The cell type provides the cell coverage area.

definitionList.name: E-UTRAN Round Trip Delay Estimation Info
descriptionList:
This IE contains the
information to assist target HRPD access with the acquisition of the UE.

elementList.name: E-UTRAN Round Trip Delay Estimation Info
elementList.description: Includes the Round Trip Delay between the eNB and the UE. The unit is 16Ts (see subclause 4.2.3 in TS 36.213 [26]).

definitionList.name: Broadcast Cancelled Area List
descriptionList: The Broadcast Cancelled Area List IE indicates the areas where broadcast was stopped successfully.

elementList.name: Cancelled Cell in Emergency Area ID List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message
  broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.
Maximum no. of Cell ID within a TAI. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within an Emergency
  Area. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Number of Broadcasts
descriptionList:
The Number of Broadcasts IE indicates
the number of times that a particular message has been broadcast in a given warning
area.

elementList.name: Number of Broadcasts
elementList.description: This IE is set to 0 if valid results are not known or not available. It is set to 65535 if the counter results have overflown.

definitionList.name: Concurrent Warning Message Indicator
descriptionList:
The Concurrent Warning Message Indicator
IE indicates to eNB that the received warning message is a new message to be scheduled
for concurrent broadcast with any other ongoing broadcast of warning messages.

elementList.name: Concurrent Warning Message Indicator
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify a PWS type warning system which allows the broadcast of multiple concurrent warning messages over the radio.

definitionList.name: CSG Membership Status
descriptionList:
This element indicates the membership
status of the UE to a particular CSG.

definitionList.name: Cell Access Mode
descriptionList:
This element indicates the access mode of
the cell accessed by the UE.

definitionList.name: Extended Repetition Period
descriptionList:
The Extended Repetition Period IE indicates the periodicity
of the warning message to be broadcast.

elementList.name: Extended Repetition Period
elementList.description: The Extended Repetition Period IE is used if the Repetition Period has a value larger than 4095. Unit [second].

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Not Possible
descriptionList:
This information element indicates that the
MME decided that the corresponding E-RAB bearer will not
be subject to data forwarding.

definitionList.name: PS Service Not Available
descriptionList:
This IE indicates that the UE is not available for the PS service in the target
cell in case of SRVCC to GERAN.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority
descriptionList:
This element indicates the paging priority
for paging a UE.

elementList.name: Paging Priority
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, )
elementList.description: Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

definitionList.name: Relay Node Indicator
descriptionList: This element indicates a relay node.

definitionList.name: Correlation ID
descriptionList:
This information
element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE key
to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and
the L-GW described in TS 23.401 [11].

definitionList.name: MDT Configuration
descriptionList:
The IE defines the MDT configuration
parameters.

elementList.name: MDT Activation
elementList.type: ENUMERATED(Immediate MDT only, Logged MDT only, Immediate MDT and Trace, , Logged MBSFN MDT)

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.

elementList.name: Measurements to Activate
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit= M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration, Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value 1 indicates activate and value 0 indicates do not activate .

elementList.name: M1 Reporting Trigger
elementList.description: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to 0 .

elementList.name: M1 Threshold Event A2
elementList.description: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1.

elementList.name: Threshold RSRP
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: Threshold RSRQ
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: M1 Periodic reporting
elementList.description: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1.

elementList.name: Report interval
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16].

elementList.name: Report amount
elementList.description: Number of reports.

elementList.name: MDT Location Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value 1 indicates activate and value 0 indicates do not activate . The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to 1 .

elementList.name: Logging interval
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16]. Unit: [second].

elementList.name: Logging duration
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16]. Unit: [minute].

elementList.name: Logging interval
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16]. Unit: [second].

elementList.name: Logging duration
elementList.description: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [16]. Unit: [minute].

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for MDT scope. Value is 32.
Maximum no. of TA subject for MDT scope. Value is 8.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the first bit set to  1  and the M1 Reporting
  Trigger IE is set to  A2event-triggered  or to  A2event-triggered periodic .

This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting
  Trigger IE is set to  periodic , or to  A2event-triggered periodic .

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the third bit set to  1 .

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to  1 .

This IE shall be present if the Measurements
  to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to  1 .

This IE shall be present if the Measurements to
  Activate IE has the seventh bit set to  1 .

This IE shall be present if the Measurements to
  Activate IE has the eighth bit set to  1 .

definitionList.name: MME Relay Support Indicator
descriptionList:
This element is set
by the MME to advertise its support of Relay functionalities.

definitionList.name: Management Based MDT Allowed
descriptionList:
This information element is used by the eNB
to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [10].

definitionList.name: GW Context Release Indication
descriptionList:
This
information element is set by the eNB to provide an indication that the MME may
release any resources related to the signalled S1 UE context (see TS 36.300
[14]).

elementList.name: GW Context Release Indication
elementList.description: This IE indicates to the MME that the eNB has successfully performed an X2 HO for the UE to a target eNB.

definitionList.name: Voice Support Match Indicator
descriptionList:
This
information element is set by the eNB to provide an indication whether the UE radio
capabilities are compatible with the network configuration for voice continuity.

definitionList.name: M3 Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement
collection.

definitionList.name: M4 Configuration
descriptionList:
This IE defines the parameters for M4
measurement collection.

definitionList.name: M5 Configuration
descriptionList:
